messages.message: Thanks for testing team! @Seb or @Venkatesh - Will you be able to show Song how to do this on IB  today?

Hi Aimé, I can’t spend time on it today before 5pm due to training prep and delivery, I can share a notebook which I worked on over the weekend to include a little bit more than RSA(it needs both AES and RSA encryption/decryption with padding and key deserialisation utility functions), rsa is only used to encrypt the key for aes file encryption (more suitable for large files). But Venkat might be able to help sooner.
Sure @Aimé. Can we do it during our call in the evening?
which call is this
bi-weekly?
Oh - I actually removed that one now haha is it still in your diary?
yeah. probably not yet synced. Okay in that case, anytime before 5 IST will work for me
great TY :slightly_smiling_face:
if not today, i’m sure tomorrow will do - will check diary

Hi @Venkatesh, I’ll share that notebook (demonstrating RSA and AES using cryptography only), I’ll try to complete a one step Apply UDF flow called EncryptDecryptFlow later today for my own benefit but could be useful as a reference.
Hi @Seb I have already converted your notebook to a UDF. Are you adding something new to it?

I was experimenting yesterday, with RSA you’ll need long keys to encrypt large JPEG/PDFs/etc binary files, so the best practice is to use symmetrical block cypher like AES SHA-256 for large files and RSA to encrypt the symmetrical AES key.
What I added is the AES stuff, with padding functions and tested on an actual JPEG file file using a serialised set of RSA keys.
Does that make sense?
I have quickly added comments to the notebook and will share shortly, can’t do more unfortunately until later. Let me know if there is anything I can help with.
oh and MD5 checksum utils, I think that will be the quickest way to ensure the decryption is valid once on the AWS env.
okay I'll refer to the notebook. Hope it's the same one that you shared before. Else, please share the link
No new one, give me 10 mins (please :slightly_smiling_face: )
okay
@Venkatesh, https://instabase.com/user/Sebastien.Durand-nb/notebooks/Sebastien.Durand/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/notebooks/cryptography.ipynb

this is the notebook, I’m seeing issues at the end cells hence the delay (AES encrypt/Decrypt is not showing what I have seen earlier, but can’t spend more time on it), but please test it and troubleshoot it if required
@Venkatesh Just retested it and works fine now, please reload and test
okay
That’s the kind of intermittent problem I have, I decrypt the  plain text of a previous encrypted message, this is with RSA
Unless there is clash between your notebook session and mine, I have  updated it so that it create the pem files to a single directory. Please reload and test
Have communicated to NatWest that we can have updated notebook for them by EOD tomorrow. Is that ok @Seb?
They are going to request key :slightly_smiling_face:
Yes, will have something working for tomorrow (I’m still tided up during the day giving training tomorrow too though)
Ah OK. Then Wednesday is fine!

@Venkatesh, @Aimé, I’ve implemented a single step UDF called EncryptFlow to be review from the IB.com (http://IB.com) at https://instabase.com/Sebastien.Durand/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/Flows/EncryptFlow/. It has a pre udf to prepare the encryption of an input folder containing the docs to encrypt, it performs the AES encryption for each file with the Apply UDF step and stores the base64 encoded AES encrypted files + RSA encrypted password (using Public key) + MD5 checksums as a Json file for each doc. A post UDF creates a zip file ready to be copied over to the destination site.

Tomorrow, I’ll complete the other Flow called DecryptFlow (i.e. the one deployed at the destination IB) which will unzip the file in the input folder of the Flow, use the RSA private key to decrypt the embedded password key to decrypt the AES encrypted files to their original sate. A post UDF will then perform a checksum comparison to ensure the integrity of the files remains the same.
